meaningEn: The Supreme God, The Almighty Creator
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Allah' 100 times daily, Allah will remove his worries and grant him peace of mind. Ref: Sahih Bukhari 748
Whoever recites 'Ya Rahman' 100 times after each prayer, Allah will remove the hardness of his heart. Ref: Tirmidhi 3524
Whoever recites 'Ya Rahim' 100 times daily, Allah will grant him mercy in this world and the hereafter. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:163

meaningEn: The King, The Absolute Ruler, The Sovereign Lord
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Malik' frequently, Allah will grant him honor, self-respect, and protection from oppression. Ref: Tirmidhi 3524

meaningEn: The Most Holy, The Most Pure
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Quddus' regularly, Allah will purify his heart from spiritual diseases. Ref: Sahih Muslim 591

meaningEn: The Source of Peace, The Flawless
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'As-Salam' 160 times daily, Allah will protect him from all calamities. Ref: Sunan Abu Dawud 5085

meaningEn: The Guardian of Faith, The Giver of Security
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Mu'min', Allah will strengthen his faith and grant him security. Ref: Sahih Bukhari 7405

meaningEn: The Protector, The Guardian, The Witness
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Muhaimin', Allah will oversee all his affairs and protect him. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:23
Whoever recites 'Al-Aziz' 40 times daily, Allah will grant him honor and strength. Ref: Sunan Ibn Majah 3861
Whoever recites 'Al-Jabbar', Allah will strengthen his heart and solve his problems. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:23
Whoever recites 'Al-Mutakabbir', Allah will elevate his status and protect from arrogance. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:23
Whoever recites 'Al-Khaliq' regularly, Allah will grant him creative wisdom. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:24
Whoever recites 'Al-Bari', Allah will make his tasks easy and perfect. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:24
Whoever recites 'Al-Musawwir', Allah will beautify his character and personality. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:24
Whoever recites 'Ya Ghaffar' frequently, Allah will forgive his sins repeatedly. Ref: Surah Taha 20:82
Whoever recites 'Al-Qahhar', Allah will grant him victory over enemies. Ref: Surah Al-Hashr 59:23
Whoever recites 'Ya Wahhab' 100 times after Isha prayer, his prayers will be accepted. Ref: Sahih Bukhari
Whoever recites 'Ya Razzaq' 10 times after Fajr, Allah will provide from unexpected sources. Ref: Surah Adh-Dhariyat 51:58
Whoever recites 'Ya Fattah' 70 times for any problem, Allah will open solutions. Ref: Surah Saba 34:26
Whoever recites 'Al-Alim', Allah will grant him knowledge and wisdom. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:29
Whoever recites 'Al-Qabid' during fear, Allah will reduce his difficulties. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:245
Whoever recites 'Al-Basit', Allah will expand his sustenance and knowledge. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:245
Whoever recites 'Al-Khafid' against oppressors, Allah will humble them. Ref: Surah Al-Waqiah 56:3
Whoever recites 'Ar-Rafi', Allah will elevate his status in both worlds. Ref: Surah Al-Mujadalah 58:11

meaningEn: The Honourer, The Bestower of Honour
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Mu'izz', Allah will grant him honor and respect. Ref: Surah Al-Imran 3:26
Whoever recites 'Al-Muzill' against enemies, Allah will disgrace them. Ref: Surah Al-Imran 3:26
Whoever recites 'As-Sami' frequently, Allah will accept his prayers quickly. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:127
Whoever recites 'Al-Basir', Allah will grant him insight and clarity. Ref: Surah Al-Hadid 57:4
Whoever recites 'Al-Hakam' during disputes, Allah will grant justice. Ref: Surah Al-Mumin 40:48
Whoever recites 'Al-Adl', Allah will instill justice in his heart. Ref: Surah An-Nahl 16:90
Whoever recites 'Ya Latif' 133 times, Allah will solve his problems subtly. Ref: Surah Ash-Shura 42:19
Whoever recites 'Al-Khabir', Allah will grant him deep understanding. Ref: Surah Al-An'am 6:18
Whoever recites 'Al-Halim', Allah will grant him patience and tolerance. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:225
Whoever recites 'Ya Azimu', Allah will increase his honor and status. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255
Whoever recites 'Ya Ghafur' seeking forgiveness, Allah will forgive his sins. Ref: Surah An-Nisa 4:110
Whoever recites 'Ash-Shakur', Allah will multiply rewards for his small deeds. Ref: Surah Fatir 35:30
Whoever recites 'Al-Ali', Allah will elevate his spiritual status. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255
Whoever recites 'Ya Kabiru', Allah will make his problems seem small. Ref: Surah Al-Hajj 22:62
Whoever recites 'Al-Hafiz', Allah will protect him from all harms. Ref: Surah Yusuf 12:64
Whoever recites 'Al-Muqit', Allah will grant him physical and spiritual strength. Ref: Surah An-Nisa 4:85
Whoever recites 'Hasbunallah wa ni'mal wakeel', Allah will suffice him. Ref: Surah An-Nisa 4:6
Whoever recites 'Al-Jalil', Allah will grant him majesty and honor. Ref: Surah Ar-Rahman 55:27
Whoever recites 'Ya Karim' frequently, Allah will bless his sustenance. Ref: Surah An-Naml 27:40
Whoever recites 'Ar-Raqib', Allah will watch over his affairs. Ref: Surah An-Nisa 4:1
Whoever recites 'Ya Mujib' before dua, Allah will accept his prayers. Ref: Surah Hud 11:61
Whoever recites 'Al-Wasi', Allah will expand his sustenance and knowledge. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:115
Whoever recites 'Al-Hakim', Allah will grant him wisdom in decisions. Ref: Surah Al-An'am 6:18
Whoever recites 'Al-Wadud', Allah will create love in hearts for him. Ref: Surah Al-Buruj 85:14
Whoever recites 'Al-Majid', Allah will honor him in both worlds. Ref: Surah Hud 11:73
Whoever recites 'Al-Ba'ith', Allah will revive his spiritual energy. Ref: Surah Al-Hajj 22:7
Whoever recites 'Ash-Shahid', Allah will be his witness against false accusations. Ref: Surah Al-Mujadalah 58:6
Whoever recites 'Al-Haqq', Allah will guide him to distinguish truth from falsehood. Ref: Surah Al-Hajj 22:6

meaningEn: The Trustee, The Disposer of Affairs
fazilatEn: Whoever says 'Hasbunallah wa ni'mal wakeel', Allah will suffice him. Ref: Surah Al-Imran 3:173
Whoever recites 'Al-Qawiy', Allah will grant him physical and spiritual strength. Ref: Surah Al-Hajj 22:40
Whoever recites 'Al-Matin', Allah will strengthen his faith and character. Ref: Surah Adh-Dhariyat 51:58
Whoever recites 'Al-Wali', Allah will become his protector and friend. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:257
Whoever recites 'Al-Hamid', Allah will record numerous praises for him. Ref: Surah Ibrahim 14:8
Whoever recites 'Al-Muhsi', Allah will account his deeds with full rewards. Ref: Surah Al-Mujadalah 58:6
Whoever recites 'Al-Mubdi' before starting work, Allah will bless it. Ref: Surah Al-Buruj 85:13
Whoever recites 'Al-Mu'id', Allah will restore what he lost. Ref: Surah An-Naml 27:64
Whoever recites 'Al-Muhyi', Allah will revive his spiritual life. Ref: Surah Fussilat 41:39
Whoever recites 'Al-Mumit' against evil, Allah will destroy its effect. Ref: Surah Al-Mumin 40:68
Whoever recites 'Al-Hayy' regularly, Allah will grant him vitality. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255
Whoever recites 'Al-Qayyum', Allah will fulfill all his needs. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:255
Whoever recites 'Al-Wajid' for lost things, Allah will help find them. Ref: Surah Adh-Dhariyat 51:56
Whoever recites 'Al-Majid', Allah will make his character noble. Ref: Surah Hud 11:73
Whoever recites 'Al-Wahid', Allah will protect him from shirk. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:163
Whoever recites 'Al-Ahad', Allah will free him from fears and anxieties. Ref: Surah Al-Ikhlas 112:1
Whoever recites 'As-Samad', Allah will fulfill all his needs. Ref: Surah Al-Ikhlas 112:2
Whoever recites 'Al-Qadir' for impossible tasks, Allah will make it possible. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:20
Whoever recites 'Al-Muqtadir', Allah will grant him power over enemies. Ref: Surah Al-Kahf 18:45
Whoever recites 'Al-Muqaddim', Allah will prioritize his good deeds. Ref: Surah Qaf 50:28
Whoever recites 'Al-Mu'akhkhir', Allah will delay his harm and evil. Ref: Surah Ibrahim 14:42
Whoever recites 'Al-Awwal', Allah will make him pioneer in good deeds. Ref: Surah Al-Hadid 57:3
Whoever recites 'Al-Akhir', Allah will grant him eternal life in paradise. Ref: Surah Al-Hadid 57:3
Whoever recites 'Az-Zahir', Allah will make truth clear to him. Ref: Surah Al-Hadid 57:3
Whoever recites 'Al-Batin', Allah will protect his secrets. Ref: Surah Al-Hadid 57:3
Whoever recites 'Al-Wali', Allah will take charge of his affairs. Ref: Surah Al-Maidah 5:55
Whoever recites 'Al-Muta'ali', Allah will elevate his status. Ref: Surah Ar-Ra'd 13:9

meaningEn: The Source of All Goodness, The Kind
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Barr', Allah will be kind to him in all matters. Ref: Surah At-Tur 52:28
Whoever recites 'Ya Tawwab' after sinning, Allah will accept his repentance. Ref: Surah An-Nisa 4:17
Whoever recites 'Al-Muntaqim' against oppressors, Allah will avenge him. Ref: Surah As-Sajdah 32:22
Whoever recites 'Ya Afuww' frequently, Allah will pardon his sins. Ref: Surah An-Nisa 4:43
Whoever recites 'Ar-Ra'uf', Allah will be compassionate to him. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:207
Whoever recites 'Malikul Mulk', Allah will make him owner of worldly and spiritual wealth. Ref: Surah Al-Imran 3:26

meaningEn: The Lord of Majesty and Bounty
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Ya Dhal Jalali wal Ikram', Allah will grant him majesty and honor. Ref: Surah Ar-Rahman 55:27
Whoever recites 'Al-Muqsit', Allah will instill justice in his heart. Ref: Surah Al-Maidah 5:8
Whoever recites 'Al-Jami', Allah will unite his scattered affairs. Ref: Surah Al-Imran 3:9
Whoever recites 'Al-Ghani', Allah will free him from all needs. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:267

meaningEn: The Enricher, The Bestower of Wealth
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Al-Mughni', Allah will enrich him spiritually and materially. Ref: Surah An-Najm 53:48
Whoever recites 'Al-Mani', Allah will protect him from harm and evil. Ref: Sahih Bukhari
Whoever recites 'Ad-Darr' against enemies, Allah will harm them. Ref: Surah Al-An'am 6:17
Whoever recites 'An-Nafi', Allah will benefit him in all matters. Ref: Surah Al-Fatihah 1:4
Whoever recites 'An-Nur', Allah will illuminate his heart, grave and resurrection. Ref: Surah An-Nur 24:35
Whoever recites 'Al-Hadi', Allah will guide him to the straight path. Ref: Surah Al-Hajj 22:54
Whoever recites 'Al-Badi', Allah will create unique solutions for his problems. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:117
Whoever recites 'Al-Baqi', Allah will make his good deeds everlasting. Ref: Surah Ar-Rahman 55:27
Whoever recites 'Al-Warith', Allah will make him inheritor of good in both worlds. Ref: Surah Al-Hijr 15:23

meaningEn: The Guide to the Right Path
fazilatEn: Whoever recites 'Ar-Rashid', Allah will guide him to right decisions. Ref: Surah Al-Mujadalah 58:10
Whoever recites 'As-Sabur' during difficulties, Allah will grant him unlimited patience. Ref: Surah Al-Baqarah 2:153
